text: Tteokguk is a traditional food of Korea. It is eaten on January 1 to celebrate Seollal, the Korean New Year. Tteokguk is a soup made from tteok ( a sweet Korean rice cake), sliced cooked eggs, ground meat, mandu, leek, and onion. == References == == Other websites == * Migi's Kitchen with a recipe for tteokguk Category:Korean food Category:Soups
title: Tteokguk
